Spraying your green gurls' with room temp water and gently wiping the leaves with a damp cloth is the perfect way to remove any dust or dirt that could find itâ€™s way onto our green gurlsâ€™ foliage. This lil routine also rinses away any tragic pest or fungal spores. While I do fertilize my plants year-round (much less in the fall and winter), the arrival of spring means my green gurls are strutting into growing season, so that extra boost of nutrition on a more frequent basis be needed, hunny! Nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium, are the primary nutrients in most houseplant fertilizers, along with secondary nutrients in smaller amounts (magnesium, calcium, sulfur, iron and boron)
